explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Flash point: 280-662degC (Solvent Pocket Book, 1997; ICSC, 1994; NFPA,13th, 2002)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140degC) substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) and the oxygen is chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set as Category 4 based on LD50= 1613mg/kg calculated by technological guidelines using 4 date of rat LD50 value (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rabbit LD50 = 8810.5mg/kg calculated by technological guidelines using three data of rabbit LD50 values, it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: The saturated vapor pressures concentrations pressure of this product is 0.37ppm. Mortality is not seen according to two rat acute toxicity tests (IUCLID (2000)) in saturated vapor pressure pressures concentrations. And LC50 level is not calculated, it cannot be classified.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Though the stimulative grades vary from severe to slight, skin irritation is observed on rabbits (ACGIH (2001) and PATTY (5th, 2001)). Since there is a description of slight to moderate irritations on human (HSDB (2005)), and it is classified into R38 in EU, it was classified as Category 2.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Severe irritation is indicated by the rabbit (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)). In humans, there is a statement that redness, a pain, severe burns and caustics are indicated (ICSC (J), (2002)), and it was classified into R41 in EU. So it was set as Category 1.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on facts that in two examinations (one of them based on the guideline 406 of OECD test) with guinea pigs sensitization was not identified ACGIH (2001), IUCLID (2000)) and that in the human patch test no sensitization was identified(IUCLID (2000)), it was put outside of Category.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There were no in vivo mutagenicity test results and there were no positive findings for in vitro tests in multiple indices. Therefore we presupposed that we could not classify it.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on what is classified into 3 according to IARC (IARC (2000)), it carried out the outside of Category.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since although concrete reproductive toxicity is not observed in each animal studies, examination being clear of administration period are in organogenetic period administration, and there is no examination data in other administration period, it cannot be classified due to insufficient data.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (liver) May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: By oral administration test of rats, within the dose of guidance value of Category 1, an anesthetic actions (a sedative action, ataxia) and a liver damage (the increase in weight, the increase of serum transaminase and other liver enzyme, opacity swelling and vacuolar degeneration, damage of endoplasmic reticulum and mitochondria )was seen (ACGIH (2001)). So it is classified into Category 1 (liver) and Category 3 (anesthetic actions).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.classification: Category 2 (liver, kidney, blood, central nervous system)
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney, blood, central nervous system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Liver and kidney weights gain and nephropathy are observed in the dosage of guidance value within the limits of Category 2 to a rat (PATTY and (5th, 2001),ACGIH (2001)), the data of anemia, such as decrease of red count, hemoglobin concentration, and hematocrit value, and demyelinate in brain and spine are observed (ACGIH (2001)), and affecting liver and kidney is observed in humans (ICSC (J), (2002)). It was classified into Category 2 (liver, the kidney, blood, central nervous system) according to the above information.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48-hour LC50=2150microg/L of Crustacea (Water flea) (AQUIRE, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (the decomposition of TOC: 96.7% (Existing Chemicals Safety Check Data)), and supposed less bio-accumulative (log Kow=-1.43 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
